493674AD2F2F4887A42D0D8AB4DF608F.description: Discuss strategies and criteria for choosing repertoire.

9AF7713219DE4195A0D137067A74534E.description: Participate in class rehearsal discussions when problem solving.

0EB8CEC09C864F7DA502BAA5CC82B477.description: Demonstrate leadership as a guitar player (e.g., offering help and guidance to other guitar players in class, being prepared for class).

B599819857CC4A0CA397E68554F21BCB.description: Create and use own practice plan to improve and prepare for rehearsal.

F9FB1856C3E146D29D49E163B1724D56.description: Examine, with guidance, the characteristics of a responsible band member.

4CDC9ABA586B42C587F46533FE2440FF.description: Examine live and recorded First Nations and Métis guitar performances.

FC49AC953F134277B2158CC59885E6CD.description: Investigate the characteristics of guitar playing in First Nations and Métis music.

AA9B9B7ED3EA421F8AF24A93CB3AFAA6.description: Use, with teacher or peer guidance, musical terminology when describing guitar playing of self and others (e.g., using the elements of music to describe the guitar playing).

1963EB77578A438AA54BE69EAFBDFFF0.description: Examine the music of contemporary Saskatchewan First Nations and Métis guitar players and songwriters.

B8225917FCE844ACAEA4F1D8708F0A88.description: Listen to and investigate ways the guitar is used in contemporary Saskatchewan First Nations and Métis music.

E83FB46B431B46B1A8BA669282773253.description: Establish a peer system (e.g., practice buddies) to support one another’s practice plans.

58AA14DD5433451EA3221E67328BADC1.description: Establish one’s own guitar goals and apply the steps necessary to achieve those goals.

7B33A94011EC4E6CBFE758C12B8AB3A3.description: Discuss the elements of effective planning for personal guitar playing growth.

9A91E8DA1F8F43338C465FA020F545AF.description: Identify resources (e.g., apps, practice trackers, games, motivation, lessons) to support practice plans.

1C0A2A528F3741EFB0E7DE65A1FC4A6B.description: Create a personal inventory to investigate the impact and role of music in one’s own life.

C479498CF0ED47E6BDD8DE7D1CD7CF3F.description: Design, implement and evaluate, with teacher and/or peer guidance, a personal practice plan.

53A737CC3FB04BC6A4C8127890B1BD62.description: Analyse live and recorded guitar performances.

E3173C1038C54D1BB85DB18DA3A2C31A.description: Generate and discuss criteria of effective guitar playing in a group or pair.

4A1024BECAD44C62BCE596018E191976.description: Examine music using ear training (e.g., finding keys, strumming patterns, rhythms).

65753EDF4A6F48FFADAFDDBF3CEE9D40.description: Analyze a range of characteristics of a guitar player.

33908F0EAC8647E1B2A60B5A9CB5CDAA.description: Identify the chords in a song using the harmonized scale.

3073747EB58D47468FF27342913F57FC.description: Use, with teacher or peer guidance, musical terminology when describing guitar playing of self and others (e.g., using the elements of music to describe the guitar playing).

484B1002EB1C42CEA57AB2F379D4A5AA.description: Examine characteristics and techniques of various genres (e.g., rock, country, pop, hip hop).

E3629D8358464E01818052CC0C52CAA7.description: Listen to and critique, with guidance, the guitar playing of self and others.

4C5BEA10B23D417C8EA1934F86EA626A.description: Critical/Responsive (CR) Goal: Students will respond to artistic expressions of Saskatchewan, Canadian and International artists using critical thinking, research, creativity and collaborative inquiry.

D7B209892C0544B3B96AE4739E78B737.description: Identify how the sharing of guitar music has evolved throughout history for producers and consumers.

58B22E0668DC45B5BA103B45E903F22D.description: Evaluate the ways guitar playing can remain part of one’s life beyond school.

A16D4B0943EA49649BDA1667981F92A0.description: Discuss how guitar music is infused in daily life (e.g., to influence consumers via advertising, shopping environments) including media (e.g., film, video games, television, social media, apps).

18AEEFE0C0FD48758CAF07E36022AB7A.description: Explain the ways that different genres/styles of guitar music influence one’s wellbeing (e.g., mood, anxiety, sense of peace).

289052BDA2F64A64AEFDB4837AED5AC2.description: Describe relationships between music and personal wellness including mental health (e.g., music therapy, social connection).

C90131D7980845CAB49F09A5B7AF1907.description: Examine the impact and role of guitar playing in personal life and investigate music careers and pathways for continuing engagement in music.

0EBE687D1AAD4420AD9008A7154EC8D1.description: Research Canadian Indigenous artists whose contemporary guitar music is influenced by traditional Indigenous music

F85800ED88694E53A7551ECB724EF50F.description: Interview or research local, Canadian or international guitar players to examine their work and careers and to improve one’s own practice.

55840938809B4C85B62C8D3DAEA0BF85.description: Conduct an inquiry to investigate who are some of the most influential local, Canadian and international guitar players.

04B66E849E9D4F22A222804B431B0840.description: Examine how guitar players influence and respond to social, political and cultural issues (e.g., world music, music concerned with human rights, environmental sustainability).

273998699E864F3882C420C1ABCA2A26.description: Explain why notable guitar players and their work are/were influential.

0BDE1358CB154FC1AD8A70EFE89DE191.description: Classify the work of guitar players who have made an impact on music

DFCE6F4F36144EE2BF57A0A5F3620105.description: Examine the work and impact of influential local, Canadian and international guitar players.

FB7CEA4F575F46248DC308967EA5D4B9.description: Reproduce particular genres of music in a stylistically appropriate manner (e.g., genres and styles such as rock, blues, country, bluegrass, folk, classical, fingerstyle, metal, Hawaiian slack key, Celtic, classical, surf, funk, flamenco, r&b/soul, reggae/ska, Brazilian).

27EA5590F8904B4085BC5538D3AD4E8A.description: Discuss guitar music from a variety of cultures and periods throughout history.

84123754EAC34BA1B486735725186488.description: Outline historical information from a variety of cultural and historical contexts.

9B6E05C458F94190B550C1AF6EA3B394.description: Compare a variety of traditional and contemporary guitar music selections.

E42F2E1129FE41F790963A6B70ADEB9F.description: Describe and play guitar music from a variety of cultural and historical contexts.

2200F142F1C3473C8164E588564504DD.description: Use the elements of music (e.g., dynamics, form, harmony, melody, rhythm, texture, timbre, tonality) and aural skills to play and create musical expressions.

2AF49590A1564AA68B41B882B3F7E689.description: Play intermediate riffs or guitar licks

72C29B815FA944A8ABDDA1E66C1D3D2F.description: Play in a group, through shared recorded tracks.

CB0EFD6719A648B0966D54C64833E764.description: Describe and/or demonstrate which of the open chords are moveable (e.g., two main moveable chords are F and B; each have a major and a minor).

440434FB4B574FDC864814B0860B9B62.description: Creative/Productive (CP) Goal: Students will inquire, create and communicate through dance, drama, music and visual art.
